EtherCATTest.Name: EtherCAT State Machine Base Test Functions
EtherCATTest.Comment: This file includes basic test functions, mainly for EtherCAT State Machine related tests. The test functions are necessary for TF-12xx test files. They can also be included in other test files. It is not intended to run this file independently.

History.HistoryEntry: Deleted "reset of expectedAlStatusCode2/3 since they are now handed over with the parameters and then are 0x0000 as necessary
Change name of VerifyAlStatusAndAlStatusCode to GetAndVerifyAlStatusAndAlStatusCode
Add GetListOfAllInputOrOutputSm (before GetAllInputSm/GetAllOutputSm are now one with parameter Outputs/Inputs)
Add test functions SetPreOpTimeout, SetSafeOpTimeout, SetBackSafeOpTimeout, SetBackInitTimeout

_Where: TestFunction "VerifyAlStatusCode" _Description: In the logger output the value of the "Read AL Status Code" was the fexpectedAlStatusCode2 _Solution: use Param2=VerifyAlStatusCode.uint16ActualAlStatusCode

_Where: TestFunction "VerifyAlStatusAndAlStatusCode" _Description: In the logger output the value of the "Read AL Status Code" was the fexpectedAlStatusCode2 _Solution: use Param2=VerifyAlStatusCode.uint16ActualAlStatusCode
_Where: TestFunction "VerifyAlStatusCode" _Description: Added ActualAlStatus and ExpectedAlStatus to parameters
_Where: TestFunction "SkipTestIfDeviceEmulationActive" _Description: Using CTT variable Esc.DeviceEmulation rather than reading register 0x0141 again.
Added GetAndVerifyAlStatusAndXStatusCodes which tests unlimited number of AL Status Codes (for #49)
_Where: SkipTestIfPreOpSafeOpStartUpCmdsRequired _Description: verify that ESI element Mailbox:Coe supported and return if not
_Where: CheckIfPreOpSafeOpStartUpCmdsRequired Description: Add missing check for root elements of PdoAssign
VerifyAlStatusCode: If test is performed as TF-1201 then skip warning that ErrofFlag = 0 and AL StatusCode unequal 0
GetAndVerifyAlStatusAndXStatusCodes: undefined variable used in Info-Message in case an invalid AL Status was returned. . Info Message was redundant. For this reason it was removed.

Add support for complex slaves which do not have mailbox SyncManagers: - add function SetSmStartAdd0x0AndLength0x2 and call it in SetWrongSyncManSettings - add ReturnIfNoMailboxSupported to function CheckIfMbxHandlerStopped
Where: CheckIfMbxHandlerStopped Description: Missing CHECKENABLE jump mark added

Where: VerifySyncManChannelDisabled Description: Checking of PD-SyncManager was fixed to SyncManager2 and SyncManager3. For slaves which do not have a Mailbox but DevEmu = FALSE a serious error occured Solution: Check for first and second Process Data SycnManager

Where: SetSyncManSettingsAccToPdoLength (used in TF-1200 #17) Description: If the SyncManager Start Address is changed due to a specific configuraiton (e.g. PD length of a SyncManager would exceed the current maximum length) the test might fail because the SyncManager start address is taken from the ESI file rather than from the current configuration (e.g. imported slave description) Solution: Use SyncManager Start Address of current config (CurrentConfig.SM[i].StartAddress). Also add CurrentConfig.SM[i].ControlByte

Where: SetSmStartAdd0x0AndLength0x2 Description: To set invalid SyncManager start address in case only one SyncManager is supported, it is not possible to use the SynManager start address of another enabled SyncManager - nor can register address 0x0000 be used Solution: Use reserved address 0x0018:0x0019; manipulate correct SyncManager (sm+1 was manipulated)
Where: SetSyncManSettingsAccToPdoLength (used in TF-1200 #17) Description: Fix Typo (SM>Sm): CurrentConfig.Sm[i].StartAddress; CurrentConfig.Sm[i].ControlByte
- Adopt EtherCATTest:Name = EtherCAT State Machine Base Test Functions - Remove Development Writeline in SetSyncManSettingsAccToPdoLength

Where: GetAndVerifyAlStatusAndStatusCode Description: Updated Outputs to indicate where the information for the expected IAL Status Code (0x1D for Outputs, 0x1E for Inputs) comes from (ESI Sm:ControlByte)
Where: SkipTestIfCurrentConfigRequiresDcAndNoCu, ReturnErrorIfCurrentConfigRequiresDcAndNoCu Description: Add Verbose Level to message that test can be performed when Cu is available
Where: ReturnErrorIfCurrentConfigRequiresDcAndNoCu Description: Fix check of CU to generate Error if non available
_Description: Added ReadDcSysTime to Read 0x0910 and 0x0990 and prompt in in the Test Log
_Where: SetBackInitTimeout/ SetBackSafeOpTimeout/ SetSafeOpTimeout _Description: correct default value from 3000ms to 500/ 200/ 10000ms
_Where: VerifySyncManChannelDisabled _Description: Fix syntac for parameter call (replace [ by {)

_Where :ReturnErrorIfCurrentConfigRequiresDcAndNoCu _Description: Add check if CurrentConfig.DcOpMode and CurrentConfig.DcAssignActivate are available and return or generate error if not. Skip test if not a DC device.
_Where: ReadDcSysTime _Description: ns-time outputs (activation via settings dialog) also printed in ms
Add output IDs and update Schema version to 1.0.31
_Where: SetSyncManSettingsAccToPdoLength _Desc: Read SyncMan-registers of currently set SyncMan before and after configuration (for debugging)
TestFunction 401, Error 12: Changed Param2 to Param1. TestFunction 401, Error 16: Removed unused Param3. TestFunction 908, Error 4 and 5: Changed Param1 to Param0.

TestFunction 1203, Error 4: Corrected Param1 from VerifyInOutputHandlerStarted.byte_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled.uint16_smAdo to VerifyInOutputHandlerStarted.uint16_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled.uint16_smAdo.
For release with CTT V2.2 set version to 1.0.0

Description.Purpose:
Checks for the list of SyncManager provided if they have been stopped
(previously InOutputHandlerStoppedInit and InOutputHandlerStopped. Now, the list of SyncManager have to be provided) Function returns if no PdSm available
Description.PreCondition: - length of provided SyncManager list greater 0: otherwise check is skipped
Description.PostCondition: Generate Error if the SyncManager is supposed to be stopped but is not stopped

Parameter.Name: CheckIfInputAndOutputHandlerStopped.ArrayOfBytes_listOfEnabledSms
Parameter.Comment: List of SyncManagers (input and output) that shall be checked by this function

Equal.Return: No enabled process data SyncManager available. Checking if Input and/ or Output handler are stopped not necessary.

TestStep.Name: ReadPdiSmControlRegisterOffset0x07FromEsc
TestStep.WriteLine: Read PDI Control Register 0x{0:x2} of SyncManager{1}

TestStep.Name: ReturnErrorIfRegisterAccessWasNotPossible
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read Syncmanager PDI Control Register 0x{0:x4}!

NotEqual.RaiseError: Handler was not stopped || Register 0x{0:x4}:00: Expected = true, Read = {1}.

TestStep.Name: WriteSuccessInfoToLogger
TestStep.WriteLine: SM{0} handler stopped successfully || Value read from 0x{1:x4}:00 = {2}.

Description.Purpose:
Check if Mailbox Handler was started, i.e. the "Deactivate SyncManger" bit of Register PDI Control SyncManager (+0x07.0) has to be false for SM0 and SM1.
If no Mailbox SMs are configured in the ESI file, the Enable attribute is false or the DefaultLength is 0 the MailboxHandlerStarted is not checked
If SyncManager0 AND SyncManager1 have the ESI element Sm@Enable = false then the MbxHandlerStarted is not checked
(previously MbxHandlerStarted)

NotEqual.Return: No MailboxOut SyncManager configured in ESI file, i .e. device does not support Mailboxes and the check if Mailbox handler was started is skipped

Equal.RaiseError: ESI element DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable is missing!
ESI element DeviceDescr.SM[1].Enable is missing!

NotEqual.Return: Mailbox SyncManagers 0 and 1 are disabled | INFO: ESI element DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable = {0}, DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable = {1}

Equal.Return: Mailbox SyncManagers are disabled (DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable not available) | Checking if Mailbox Handler was started is skipped
Mailbox SyncManagers are disabled (DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable = {0}) | Checking if Mailbox Handler was started is skipped

TestStep.Name: CHECKIFSTARTED
TestStep.Description: Read Deactivate Bit of MbxOut SyncManager (Sm0) PDI Control register 0x0807.0 and check if false (= Handler Started)
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read PDI Control Register 0x0807!

NotEqual.RaiseError: MbxOutputHandler not started || Register 0x0807:00: Expected = false, Read = {0}.

TestStep.Name: Read0x080FFromEsc
TestStep.Description: Read Deactivate Bit of MbxIn SyncManager (Sm1) PDI Control register 0x080F.0 and check if false (= Handler Started)
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read PDI Control Register 0x0807!

NotEqual.RaiseError: MbxInputHandler not started || Register 0x080F:00: Expected = false, Read = {0}.

Description.Purpose:
Reads the Deactivate SyncManager Bit in the PDI Control SyncManager register (+0x07.0). If Deactivate Bit is not true (sm deactivated) then an Error is raised
(previously MbxHandlerStopped)

NotEqual.Return: No MailboxOut SyncManager configured in ESI file, i .e. device does not support Mailboxes and the check if Mailbox handler was started is skipped

Equal.RaiseError: ESI element DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable is missing!
ESI element DeviceDescr.SM[1].Enable is missing!

NotEqual.Return: Mailbox SyncManagers 0 and 1 are disabled | INFO: ESI element DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable = {0}, DeviceDescr.SM[0].Enable = {1}

TestStep.Name: CHECKENABLE
TestStep.Description: Read SyncManager0 PDI Control register 0x807 from ESC
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read register 0x0807 when checking if mailbox handler was stopped.

TestStep.Description: Check if SyncManager0 was disabled by host controller, i.e. 0x0807.0 = true (= MbxOutHandler stopped)

NotEqual.RaiseError: Output Mailbox Handler not stopped || Register 0x0807:00: Expected = true, Read = {0}

TestStep.Description: Read SyncManager0 PDI Control register 0x80E from ESC
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read register 0x080F when checking if mailbox handler was stopped.

TestStep.Description: Check if SyncManager1 was disabled by host controller, i.e. 0x080F.0 = true (= MbxInHandler stopped)

NotEqual.RaiseError: Input Maiblox Handler not stopped || Register 0x080F:00): Expected = true, Read = {0}

Description.Purpose: Test goes from ErrPreOp to SafeOp.Therefore, start-up commands from PreOp to SafeOp cannot be sent.
Description.PreCondition: ESI attributes PdoConfig, PdoAssign, Coe:InitCmds are used
Description.PostCondition: Return bRequired = true if such start-up commands are required

TestStep.Description: Test goes from ErrPreOp to SafeOp.Therefore, start-up commands from PreOp to SafeOp cannot be sent. Check if this part of the test needs to be skipped in such a case.

Description.Purpose: (Previously CheckifSmEnabled) - Check if SyncManager specified by smNumber is described in ESI file
Description.PreCondition: - Slave must support mailbox communication if Esi:PdoUpload = true - SyncManager provided to the function described in ESI file
Description.Action: - Check if PdoUpload in ESI file is true. In this case upload PDO configuration from slave - If PdoUpload is false use PdoConfiguration from ESI file - Check if PDO length of this SyncManager is greater 0
Description.PostCondition: Return smDisabled: if true = PDO length is unequal 0

Parameter.Name: CheckIfSyncManEnabled_byteSyncManNumber
Parameter.Comment: Check if this SyncManager shall be enabled

TestStep.Name: InitSyncManDisabled
TestStep.Description: TEST FUNCTION "CheckIfSyncManEnabled" start

TestStep.Name: LoggerInfo_WhichSyncManIsTested
TestStep.WriteLine: TEST FUNCTION "CheckIfSyncManEnabled" | Check if SyncManager{0} is enabled (according to PDO length)

TestStep.Name: CheckIfPdoUploadSetInEsi
TestStep.Description: Check if ESI element Mailbox:Coe@PdoUpload is available and if true

TestStep.Name: LengthOfSmNumberUnequal0
TestStep.Description: Since PDO length is {0}...

Equal.Return: SyncManager{0}: According to PDO length ({2} byte) Disable = {1}

TestStep.Name: PDOUPLOADfalse
TestStep.Description: Check in ESI file if SyncMan{0} enabeld

Equal.Return: SyncManager{0}: According to PDO length ({2} byte) Disable = {1}

TestStep.Name: SMENABLED
TestStep.WriteLine: TEST FUNCTION "CheckIfSmEnabled" | SyncManager{0}: According to PDO length ({2} byte) Disable = {1}

Description.Purpose: - Check if SyncManager specified by smNumber is described in ESI file - Check if SyncManager length > 0: if PdoUpload = false. check ESI file, if PdoUpload = true check process data configuration for this SyncManager online

Equal.WriteLine: "CheckIfThisSmEnabled" | Check if ESI element Mailbox:Coe@PdoUpload available and if true

TestStep.Name: LOGGER_OUTPUT
TestStep.WriteLine: SyncManager{0}: According to PDO length ({2} byte) Disable = {1}

Description.Purpose:
Receives a list of SyncManagers and extracts those which shall be enabled according to their SyncManager/ PDO length. Return value is a list of enabled process data SyncManagersMakes.
#### Previous function GetAllEnabledSm Parameter: - allSm (all SM which shall be checked if enabled) - smCount (number of SMs in the array) ## deleted
Return values: - allEnabledSm - noEnabledSm ## deleted - enabledSmCount ## deleted
#######
Description.PreCondition: - Slave must support mailbox communication if Esi:PdoUpload = true (function CheckIfSyncManEnabled) - Parameter: List of SyncManagers
Description.Action: - Check if received list is longer than 0 - Get one SyncManager from the received list at a time - Check if this SyncManager is enabled acc. to its PDO length
Description.PostCondition: - If SyncManager length is greater 0 it is added to the list of allEnabledSm

Description.Purpose: From a list of process data SycnManagers this function extracts those which shall be enable according to their process data length (Previous Name = GetAllEnabledSm)
Description.PreCondition: Slave has to be at least in PreOp state
Description.Action: Check SyncManager if need to be enabled according to ESI length or if PdoUpload= true to online configuration
Description.PostCondition: List with all SyncManagers which shall be enabled according to the PDO length / SyncManager length

Parameter.Name: ExtractEnabledSmFromList.ArrayOfBytes_smSourceList
Parameter.Comment: allSm (all SM which shall be checked if enabled)

Equal.WriteLine: "ExtractEnabledSmFromList" | listOfEnabledSm = [{0}] after initialization | smNumber = {3} ||| smSourceList = {2} | lengthOfList = {1}

TestStep.Name: WriteTestFunctionResultToLogger
TestStep.WriteLine: List of SyncManagers that shall be enabled according to PDO length = [{0}]

Description.Purpose: Gets a list with all enabled input process data SyncManagers (PDO length greater 0)

OutParameter.Name: GetAllEnabledInputSyncMan_ArrayOfBytesAllInputSyncMan
OutParameter.Comment: Array of Bytes with all enabled Input SyncManager

TestStep.Name: GetAllInputSyncMan
TestStep.Description: Get a list with all input SyncManagers

Description.Purpose: Takes an array of SyncManagers and checks which are enabled acc. to their length.

Parameter.Name: GetAllEnabledSyncMan_ArrayOfBytesSyncMan
Parameter.Comment: List of SyncManager which shall be filtered for enabled SyncManagers

Description.Purpose: Get input process datat SyncManager from ESI file element Sm (possible are 16 SyncManagers)
Description.PreCondition: SyncManager in ESi file element Sm defined at all
Description.Action: - Check ESI element Sm for type = "Input" and attribute Virtual = false
Description.PostCondition: - Raise error if no SyncManager in element Sm defined - Return ArrayOfBytes with list of Input SyncManager

Equal.RaiseError: INFO | No Sm Element in ESI defined!
INFO: No Sm:Text defined in ESI for SyncManager{0}

Description.Purpose: Get output process datat SyncManager from ESI file element Sm (possible are 16 SyncManagers)
Description.PreCondition: SyncManager in ESi file element Sm defined at all
Description.Action: - Check ESI element Sm for type = "Output" and attribute Virtual = false
Description.PostCondition: - Raise error if no SyncManager in element Sm defined - Return ArrayOfBytes with list of Output SyncManager

Equal.RaiseError: INFO | No Sm Element in ESI defined!
INFO: No Sm:Text defined in ESI for SyncManager{0}

Description.Purpose: Validates AL Status and AL Status Code (3 different Status Codes can be possible) against expected values
Description.Action: Read AL Status cand AL Status Code with 6 byte continues read access from ESC.
Description.PostCondition: Generate Error if read values unequal expected values. If ErrFlag equal 0 and AlStatusCode unequal 0 then raise warning

TestStep.Name: ReadAlStatusAndStatusCodeFromEsc
TestStep.Description: Read AL Status and AL Status Code from device
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read register 0x0135:0x0130

TestStep.Name: ExtractAlStatusCode
TestStep.WriteLine: Expected AL Status = 0x{0:x2}, Read = 0x{1:x2} || Info: Expected AL Status Code = 0x{2:x2}, Read = 0x{3:x2}

NotEqual.RaiseError: Invalid AL Status || Expected AL Status = 0x{0:x2}, Read = 0x{1:x2} || Info: Expected AL Status Code = 0x{2:x2}, Read = 0x{3:x2}

NotEqual.RaiseWarning: Invalid AL Status || Expected AL Status = 0x{0:x2}, Read = 0x{1:x2} || Info: Expected AL Status Code = 0x{2:x2} (ESI element Sm:ControlByte indicates this SyncManager direction), Read = 0x{3:x2}

Equal.Return: INFO | AL Status Codes are not verified when Settings.Warning = true

NotEqual.RaiseWarning: Recommended AL Status Code 0x{1:x4} should be used! || Read AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}
AL Status Code should be 0 when ErrorFlag of AL Status reigster is false || INFO: Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}, Read = 0x{1:x4}, Expected AL Status = 0x{2:x4}, Read = 0x{3:x4}

NotEqual.RaiseError: Invalid AL Status Code || Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}, Read = 0x{1:x4} || Info: Expected AL Status = 0x{2:x4}, Read = 0x{3:x4}
Invalid AL Status Code || Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}, Read = 0x{1:x4} || Info: AL Status = 0x{2:x4}
Invalid AL Status Code || Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}

Description.Purpose: Validates AL Status and AL Status Code (an unlimited list of AL Status Codes can be provided) against expected values
Description.Action: Read AL Status cand AL Status Code with 6 byte continues read access from ESC.
Description.PostCondition: Generate Error if read values unequal expected values. If ErrFlag equal 0 and AlStatusCode unequal 0 then raise warning

TestStep.Name: ReadAlStatusAndStatusCodeFromEsc
TestStep.Description: Read AL Status and AL Status Code from device
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read register 0x0135:0x0130

TestStep.Name: ExtractAlStatusCode
TestStep.WriteLine: Expected AL Status = 0x{0:x2}, Read = 0x{1:x2} || Info: Expected AL Status Code List = 0x{2:x}, Read = 0x{3:x2}

NotEqual.RaiseError: Invalid AL Status || Expected AL Status = 0x{0:x2}, Read = 0x{1:x2}

NotEqual.RaiseWarning: Invalid AL Status || Expected AL Status = 0x{0:x2}, Read = 0x{1:x2}

Equal.Return: INFO | AL Status Codes are not verified when Settings.Warning = true
Exception | No allowed AL Status Code defined by test.

Equal.WriteLine: DEBUG MSG | Current Check vs. allowed AL Status Code = 0x{0:x0}

Equal.Return: AL Status Code 0x{0:x2} is valid

GreaterOrEqual.RaiseError: Invalid AL Status Code 0x{0:x4} || expected AL Status Codes Array = {1}

Description.Purpose:
Makes a list with all SyncManagers which shall be enabled according to the PDO length / SyncManager length
(previously GetAllEnabledPdSm, Parameter: - allSm (all SM which shall be checked if enabled) - smCount (number of SMs in the array) Return values: - allEnabledSm - noEnabledSm - enabledSmCount )
Description.PreCondition: Slave has to be at least in PreOp state (since function ExtractEnabledSmFromList is called)
Description.Action: Gets all enabled Input-Sm and all enabeld Output-Sm with function GetListOfEnabledInputOrOutputSm and adds them to one single list
Description.PostCondition: Return list with all enabled Input and Output SyncManagers

TestStep.Name: WriteTestFunctionResultToLogger
TestStep.WriteLine: List of all enabled SyncManagers that shall be enabled according to PDO length = [{0}]

Description.Purpose:
Finds all either input and output SyncManagers (ESI based, i.e. offline) (possible are 16 entities). Only adds SyncManagers with Virtual = false
previous return values (not supported any more) : noInputSm inputSmCount firstInputSm
Previous Name: GetAllInputSm, GetallOutputSm
Description.PreCondition: Slave can be in any ESM state
Description.PostCondition: Disable = 0: Pdo length for this SyncManager is >0: Disable = 1: PDO length for this SyncManager is = 0

LocalVariables.Name: GetListOfAllInputOrOutputSm.b_localDebugMsg
LocalVariables.Comment: Logger ouputs are written only for debugging of this test function

OutParameter.Name: GetListOfAllInputOrOutputSm.ArrayOfBytes_AllInputOrOutputSm
OutParameter.Comment: Depending on the type (outputs or Inputs) a list of this type is returned

Equal.RaiseError: INFO | No Sm Element in ESI defined!
INFO: No Sm:Text element defined in ESI for SyncManager{0}

TestStep.Name: LoggerOutput
TestStep.WriteLine: List of all {0} SyncManagers = {1}

Description.Purpose:
Based on the ESI file it merges arrays of allOutputSm and all allInputSm
Previously GetAllPdSm
Return values deleted frp, original function: - noPdSm - pdSmCount
Description.PreCondition: Slave can be in any ESM state

LocalVariables.Name: GetListOfAllPdSm.b_localDebugMsg
LocalVariables.Comment: Logger ouputs are written only for debugging of this test function

Equal.WriteLine: "GetListOfAllPdSm" | After Getting all Output SyncManager | GetListOfAllPdSm.ArrayOfByte_allPdSm = {0}

Description.Purpose:
Gets a list with all enabled output or input process data SyncManagers (PDO length greater 0).
Return values: - allEnabledOutputSm - noEnabledOutputSm - enabledOutputSmCount
Previously "GetAllEnabledOutputSm"
Description.PreCondition: Slave has to be at least in PreOp state (since function ExtractEnabledSmFromList is called)
Description.Action: Gets a list with all Input or Output SyncManagers and extracts a list with the enabled SyncManagers
Description.PostCondition: Return list with enabled Input or Output SyncManagers

Equal.WriteLine: List of enabled {0}-SyncManagers that shall be enabled according to PDO length = [{1}]

Description.Purpose:
Makes a logger Output that Output SyncManger shall be set to received process values
(previously LocalOutputHandlerStarted)
Description.PreCondition: Slave has to be at least in PreOp state (since GetListOfEnabledInputOrOutputSm is called)

TestStep.Name: LoggerInfoOutputShallBeInSafeState
TestStep.WriteLine: INFO | Outputs shall be set to received process values!

Description.Purpose:
Makes a logger Output that Output SyncManger shall be set to safe values.
(previously LocalOutputHandlerStopped)
Description.PreCondition: Slave is at least in PreOp state
Description.Action: Gets a list of all enabled output SyncManager and checks if this list is longer than 0
Description.PostCondition: Make logger output that output values shall be set to safe value

TestStep.Name: LoggerInfoOutputShallBeInSafeState
TestStep.WriteLine: INFO | Outputs shall be set to safe values!

Description.Purpose:
Makes a logger Output that Output SyncManger shall be set to safe values. Use GetListOfEnabledInputOrOutputSm ("Outputs") in state when mbx communicatino supported
(previously LocalOutputHandlerStoppedInit)
Description.PreCondition: List of enabled output SyncManager is unequal 0.
Description.Action: Checks the paramter "ListOfEnabledOutputSm" has at least one item. If list is 0 the function returns
Description.PostCondition: Make logger output that local outputs shall be set to safe value

TestStep.Name: LoggerOutput
TestStep.WriteLine: Outputs shall be set to safe values!

Description.Purpose: Check if CurrentConfig has a DC element, a DC:OpMode element, a Dc:OpMode:AssignActivate element and if AssignActivate activates a Sync-Signal.
Description.Action: If yes check if Cu2508 available, otherwise generate error If not, skip test

Parameter.Name: ReturnErrorIfCurrentConfigRequiresDcAndNoCu.bDcSpecificTest
Parameter.Comment: True: Test must be performed for DC slaves. And must be skipped for non-DC slaves False: Skip if non-Dc slave

TestStep.Name: LOGGER_INFO_ABOUT_TEST_EVENT
TestStep.Description: Check if current configuration of DuT has AssignAcitvate == 0x0000 or realtime-enabling hardware connected.

Equal.RaiseError: Mandatory element AssignActivate of Dc:OpMode not available

Equal.SkipCase: DC-specific test and DC not supported (ESI element Dc in current config not available)
DC-specific test and DC not supported (ESI element Dc:OpMode in current config not available)

Equal.RaiseError: Mandatory element AssignActivate of Dc:OpMode not available

Equal.SkipCase: DC-specific test and DC not supported (ESI element Dc:OpMode:AssignActivate = 0x0000)

Equal.WriteLine: Realtime enabling hardware connected. Slave can be tested with its DC modes.

Equal.RaiseError: DcOpMode of current DuT configuration requires realtime-enabling hardware to perform this test. Connect CU2508.

Description.Purpose: Read DC System Time 0x0910 from ESC and write to logger if Parameter is set. Checks if SysTime is 32 o 64 bit wide

TestStep.WriteLine: 0x0910 = {0}ns = {1}ms (DcSysTime32)
0x0990 = {0}ns = {1}ms ( NextDcEventTime32)
0x0910 = {0}ns = {1}ms (DcSysTime64)
0x0990 = {0}ns = {1}ms (NextDcEventTime64)

Description.Purpose: Set ESM safeOPTimeout to default value. If value defined in ESI file set to this value. Timeout time for state transition from OP/SAFEOP/PREOP/BOOT INIT SAFEOP PREOP. Default value: 5000ms
Set ESM safeOPTimeout (Op > Safetp) to default value. If value defined in ESI file set to this value. Timeout time for state transition from OP SAFEOP. Default value: 200ms
Sets Bootstrap Mailbox settings (previously SetSm01Boot)
Description.PreCondition: ESI file has Maibox SyncManageres in ESI element Sm
Description.Action: - Get Bootstrap SyncManager Settings from ESI element Eeeprom:Bootstrap - Deactiviate MailboxSyncManagers to ensure access - Set Bootstrap SyncManager setttings
Description.PostCondition: Send logger info if deactivation or setting of Mbx SyncManagers not possible

Equal.Return: Device description does not contain an element for Sm[0]:DefaultSize
Device description does not contain an element for Sm[1]:DefaultSize

TestStep.Name: DisableSm0
TestStep.Description: Disable SyncManager 0 to ensure access to SyncManager Settings Registers
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to disable SyncManager 0 for Bootstrap

TestStep.Name: SetSm0WithBootstrapSettings
TestStep.Description: Set SyncManager 0 with Bootstrap Settings
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to set boot sync manager settings of SyncManager 0 for Bootstrap

TestStep.Name: DisableSm1
TestStep.Description: Disable SyncManager 1 to ensure access to SyncManager Settings Registers
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to disable SyncManager 1 for Bootstrap

TestStep.Name: SetSm1WithBootstrapSettings
TestStep.Description: Set SyncManager 1 with Bootstrap Settings
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to set boot sync manager settings of SyncManager 1 for Bootstrap

Description.Purpose: Set mailbox SyncManager settings
Description.PreCondition: - ESI element SyncManager available - Check if first Sm is an Output Mailbox SyncManager. If not check if Input Mbx SyncManager available
Description.Action: - Get Bootstrap SyncManager Settings from ESI element Sm - Set Bootstrap SyncManager setttings
Description.PostCondition: Raise error in logger if setting Mbx SyncManagers not possible

Equal.RaiseError: INFO | No Sm Element in ESI defined!
INFO: No Sm:Text element defined in ESI for SyncManager0

TestStep.Name: SetSm0
TestStep.Description: Set SyncManager 0 settings according to ESI
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to set SyncManager settings of SyncManager 0

TestStep.Name: SetSm1
TestStep.Description: Set SyncManager 1 settings according to ESI
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to set SyncManager settings of SyncManager 1

Description.Purpose: Set ESM preOPTimeout to default value. If value defined in ESI file set to this value. Timeout time for state transition from INIT PREOP/BOOT. Default value: 3000ms
Set ESM safeOPTimeout (SafeOp > Op) to default value. If value defined in ESI file set to this value. Timeout time for state transition from SAFEOP OP, PREOP SAFEOP, Default value: 10000ms

Sets all available process data SyncManagers according to PdoLength
This functions - sets all Input/Output-SmSettings according to PDO configuration: + when PdoUpload=1, then SM-Objects from online-OD are read and Sm-Settings calculated + when PdoUpload = 0, then PDOs assigned to Sm by default are used to calculate SM-Settings
- when ESI:Mailbox:CoE:PdoUpload is not set the ESI-SyncManagerSettings are set
NOTE: This function makes only sense when device supports Mbx since SDO services are used and when device is at least in PreOp State

TestStep.Name: ANYPDSM
TestStep.Description: Get a list with all Process Data SyncManagers

TestStep.Name: GET_COUNT_OF_PD_SM
TestStep.WriteLine: Start to get SyncManager{0} length || index32 = {1}

Equal.WriteLine: INFO || SyncManager settings for 0x{0:x2} before writing valid settings = 0x{1:x8}

TestStep.Name: PDOUPLOADFALSE_SET_ESI_PD_SM
TestStep.Description: Set SyncManager{0} according to ESI description, while Sm@Enable attribute is set according to default PDO length of ESI file

TestStep.Name: PDOUPLOADTRUE_GET_DEFAULT_LENGTH_FROM_ONLINE_OD
TestStep.Description: Set SyncManager{0} according to PdoLength read from online object dictionary (ESI element PdoUpload = TRUE)

TestStep.Name: ENABLESETTING_GET_LENGTH_OF_SM
TestStep.Description: Since PDO length is {0}...

TestStep.Name: SetEnableToTrue
TestStep.Description: ...enable SyncManager

TestStep.Name: ELSE_SET_ENABLE_FALSE
TestStep.Description: ...disable SyncManager

TestStep.Name: MAKESMINPUTSETTINGS
TestStep.Description: Write SyncManager{0} registers | StartAddress = {1:x} | ControlByte = {2:x} | Enable = {3}

Equal.WriteLine: INFO || SyncManager settings for 0x{0:x2} after writing valid settings = 0x{1:x8}

Description.Purpose:
Sets invalid SyncManager settings. Only used when no other enabled SM available from which the Sm Settings could be used.
Writes invalid SM-length (0x0002) and invalid SM-Start addres 0x0018:0x0019 (reserved) to the SyncManager in question

TestStep.Name: WriteInvalidSmStartAddress
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to write invalid SM start address (0x{0:x2}) to SyncManager{1}
TestStep.WriteLine: Wrong SM start address written to SM{0}, Start Address written = 0x{1:x2}

TestStep.Name: WriteInvalidSmLength
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to write invalid SM length (0x{0:x2}) to SyncManager{1}
TestStep.WriteLine: Wrong length written to SM{0}, Length written = 0x{1:x2} bytes

TestStep.Name: WriteSmEnable
TestStep.WriteLine: Enable Sm{0} to activate wrong start address settings

Description.Purpose:
Sets wrong SmSettings for specified SyncManager: - if SM enabled: disable - if disabled: Write start address and length of other enabled SM
Parameter: - smNo (SyncManager for which wrong SmSettings shall be written)
Return Values: - smType (Inputs 0, MbxInput 2, Outputs 4, MbxOutputs 6) if Sm enabled -> disable if Sm disabled -> write startAdress of the first enabled Sm found and enable
Used Variables: - nullByte - VerifySyncManChannelDisabled.uint16_smAdo - smNo - otherSm

TestStep.Name: ReadActivateRegisterFromEsc
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read SmControl Byte of SyncManager{0}

TestStep.Name: IfSyncManagerIsEnabledThenDisableNow_WithSmControlEq0_andReturn
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to disable SyncManager{0}
TestStep.WriteLine: Info | Disable Sm{0} to enforce wrong SyncManager settings

Equal.RaiseError: No ESI element Device:Sm[{0}] available while Bootstrap is supported which needs SM0 and SM1
No ESI element Device:Sm[{0}].Enable available while Bootstrap is supported which needs SM0 and SM1

TestStep.Name: WriteStartAddressOfOtherSm
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to write start address of SyncManager{0} to SyncManager{1}
TestStep.WriteLine: Wrong Start Address written to SM (SetWrongSyncManSettings.byte_smNo) = {0}, Start Address taken from Sm (otherSm) = {1}

TestStep.Name: WriteLenghtOfOtherSm
TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to write start address of SyncManager{0} to SyncManager{1}
TestStep.WriteLine: Wrong length written to SM (SetWrongSyncManSettings.byte_smNo) = {0}, Length taken from Sm (otherSm) = {1}

TestStep.Name: WriteSmEnable
TestStep.WriteLine: Enable Sm{0} to activate wrong start address settings

Description.Purpose: Skips test case if ESI element IdentificationReg134 = false or if parameter "isTf-1201TestFile" is false
Description.PreCondition: - This function is only executed if the parameter reg134Supported is true
Description.Action: - Check root of IdentificationReg134 and the value itsel if true.
Description.PostCondition: - If true: return - if false: skip test

Equal.SkipCase: Explcit Device Identification with register 0x0134 not supported -> skip case | INFO: ESI element DeviceDescr.Info not available
Explcit Device Identification with register 0x0134 not supported -> skip case | INFO: ESI element DeviceDescr.Info.IdentificationReg134 not available
Explcit Device Identification with register 0x0134 not supported -> skip case | INFO: ESI element DeviceDescr.Info.IdentificationReg134 = {0}

Equal.Return: performTestAnyways = true

TestStep.Name: LOGGER_INFO_ABOUT_TEST_EVENT
TestStep.Description: Check if current configuration of DuT has AssignAcitvate == 0x0000 or realtime-enabling hardware connected.

Equal.WriteLine: DC not supported (ESI element Dc not available)
Realtime enabling hardware connected. Slave can be tested with its DC modes.

Equal.RaiseWarning: DcOpMode of current DuT configuration requires realtime-enabling hardware or shall pass the test according to ETG.7000 EtherCAT Conformance Test Speciffication Amendment for DC Devices.

Equal.SkipCase: Test is skipped. Test shall be performed manually according to ETG.7000!

Description.Purpose: Checks if device emulatoin bit in register 0x0141 Bit 0 is set and skips test with putting a message to the logger
Description.Action: get Device Emulation bit (0x0141) via CTT tool variable
Description.PostCondition: Skip Test if true and write message to looger

Equal.SkipCase: Device Emulation active. Test Case does not apply to Simple Devices -> Skip Test Case.

Description.Purpose: Test goes from ErrPreOp to SafeOp.Therefore, start-up commands from PreOp to SafeOp cannot be sent.
Description.PreCondition: ESI attributes PdoConfig, PdoAssign, Coe:InitCmds are used
Description.PostCondition: Skip test if such start-up commands are required

TestStep.Description: Test goes from ErrPreOp to SafeOp.Therefore, start-up commands from PreOp to SafeOp cannot be sent. Check if test needs to be skipped in such a case.

Equal.SkipCase: Skip | Slave requires PreOp-SafeOp start-up commands.
Skip | Slave requires PreOp-SafeOp start-up commands.

NotEqual.SkipCase: Skip | Slave requires PreOp-SafeOp start-up commands.

Description.Purpose: Validates AL Status and AL Status Code(1,2) and, if necessary raises an error. It does not read registers.
Description.Action: compare the provides AL Status and the AL Status Codes . No Register are read

NotEqual.RaiseError: Invalid AL Status || Expected AL Status = 0x{0:x2}, Read = 0x{1:x2} || Info: Expected AL Status Code = 0x{2:x2}, Read = 0x{3:x2}
Invalid AL Status Code || Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}, Read = 0x{1:x4} || Info: Expected AL Status = 0x{2:x2}, Read = 0x{3:x2}
Invalid AL Status Code || Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4} or 0x{1:x4}, Read = 0x{2:x2} || Info: AL Status = 0x{3:x2}

Description.Purpose: Validates the actual AL Status Code against two possible AL Status Codes and, if necessary raises an error.
Description.Action: compare the provides AL Status Code. No Register are read
Description.PostCondition: If ErrFlag = 0 and AlStatusCode unequal 0 then raise warning, if run for TF-1200. Skip Warning if test is run as TF-1201

NotEqual.RaiseWarning: AL Status Code should be 0 when ErrorFlag of AL Status reigster is false || INFO: Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}, Read = 0x{1:x4}, Expected AL Status = 0x{2:x4}, Read = 0x{3:x4}

NotEqual.RaiseError: Invalid AL Status Code || Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4}, Read = 0x{1:x4} || Info: Expected AL Status = 0x{2:x2}, Read = 0x{3:x2}
Invalid AL Status Code || Expected AL Status Code = 0x{0:x4} or 0x{1:x4}, Read = 0x{2:x2} || Info: AL Status = 0x{3:x2}

Description.Purpose: Checks for all Process Data Input and Output SyncManager if handler was started and generates a logger output if successfull or not
Description.PreCondition: - At least on enabled PD Sm available - Slave has to be at least in PreOp state (since function GetListOfAllEnabledSm ->ExtractEnabledSmFromList is called)
Description.Action: Read PD SM Control register (+0x07.0) and check if false
Description.PostCondition: - If false: success logger output - If true: Error logger output

Equal.Return: No enabled process data SyncManager available. Checking if Input and/ or Output handler are stopped not necessary.

TestStep.Name: GET_PD_SM_NUMBER_TO_CHECK_IF_ENABLED
TestStep.WriteLine: Start to check if Handler for SyncManager{0} was started

TestStep.Name: ReadPdiSmControlRegister_0x07
TestStep.WriteLine: Read PDI Control Register of SyncManager{0}

TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read Syncmanager PDI Control Register 0x{0:x4}!

NotEqual.RaiseError: Handler was not started|| Register 0x{1:x4}:00: Expected = false, Read = {0}.

TestStep.Name: LoggerOutput_partSuccessfull
TestStep.WriteLine: SM{0} handler start successfull

Description.Purpose: Spec: "..SyncManager 2 shall be disabled. Only if there is no Output SyncManager or an input error occurs the Input SyncManager shall be disabled while SyncManager 2 remains enabled." - If no PdSm > Skip - If no enabled PdSm > Skip - If one enabled PdSm > first (enabled or disabled) PdSm = "Sm2" and Sm2+1 = "Sm3 (there must be no Mailbox-Sm in between)
Description.PreCondition: - Slave at least in PreOp

TestStep.Name: ReturnIfNoEnabledPdSmSupported
TestStep.Description: Only check if SmChannelDisabled when at least one enabled process data SyncManager available

Equal.Return: No enabled process data SyncManager found. Checking if SyncManager was disable by host controller not necessary.

TestStep.Name: GetSmNumberForSmY_ThisMayNotBeEnabled
TestStep.WriteLine: First Process Data SyncManaager = {0} (usually SyncManager2) | Following Process Data SyncManager = {1} (usually SyncManager3)

TestStep.Name: GetSmX_PdiControlReg
TestStep.Description: At least one enabled process data SyncManager found (SyncMan{0}), i.e. it needs to be checked if one PD SyncManager was deactivated by host controller.

TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read Syncmanager PDI Control Register 0x{0:x4}!

TestStep.Name: GetSmX_DeactivatedBit
TestStep.WriteLine: Read PDI Control Register from 0x{0:x4} = 0x{1:x4} | Bit 0 (Deactivate SyncManager by PDI) = {2}

TestStep.RaiseErrorOnFailure: Failed to read Syncmanager PDI Control Register 0x{0:x4}!

TestStep.Name: GetSmY_DeactivateBit
TestStep.WriteLine: Read PDI Control Register from 0x{0:x4} = 0x{1:x4} | Bit 0 (Deactivate SyncManager by PDI) = {2}

Equal.WriteLine: DEBUG_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled | SmXenabled | yes: Check if SM2 deactivated | no: Check if SM3 deactivated
DEBUG_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled | Sm2Enabledyes__Sm2DeactivatedYes | SM2 deactivated ? | yes: check if SM3 activated
DEBUG_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled | Sm2Enabledyes__Sm2DeactivatedNo | SM2 activated ? | yes: check if SM3 deactivated

Equal.Return: No SyncManager{0} described in ESI file (element Sm:Text) -> no check if SyncManager{0} is deactivated by PDI

Equal.WriteLine: DEBUG_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled | Sm2Enabledyes__Sm2DeactivatedNo__Sm3InEsi_Sm3enabledNo | yes: check if deactivated | no: error

Equal.RaiseError: One SyncManager has to be deactivated. Since SyncManager{0} is not enabled / not deactivated SyncManager{1} shall be deactivated by PDI side.
One SyncManager has to be deactivated. Since SyncManager{0} is not enabled/ not deactivated SyncManager{1} shall be deactivated by PDI side.

Equal.Return: INFO | SyncManager3 was deactivated by host controller
No SyncManager{0} described in ESI file (element Sm:Text) -> no check if SyncManager{0} is deactivated by PDI

TestStep.Name: Sm2EnabledNo_Sm3InEsi_Sm3EnabledNo
TestStep.Description: S18: SM3 enabled ? yes: check if deactivated no: return

Equal.WriteLine: DEBUG_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled | Sm2EnabledNo_Sm3InEsi_Sm3EnabledNo | yes: check if deactivated | no: return

Equal.Return: INFO | SyncManager{0} and SyncManager{1} are disabled

NotEqual.RaiseError: One SyncManager has to be deactivated. Since SyncManager{0} is not enabled/ not deactivated SyncManager{1} shall be disabled by PDI side.

Equal.Return: INFO | SyncManager{0} was deactivated by host controller
No SyncManager{0} described in ESI file (element Sm:Text) -> no check if SyncManager{0} is deactivated by PDI

Equal.WriteLine: DEBUG_VerifySyncManChannelDisabled | Sm2enabledYes_Sm2DeactivatedYes_Sm3InEsi_Sm3enabledNo | yes: Check if activated | no: return

Equal.Return: INFO | SyncManager{0} is not enabled

Equal.RaiseError: Only one SyncManager shall be deactivated. Since SyncManager{0} is deactivated SyncManager{1} shall remain enabled.

TestStep.Name: Sm2enabledYes_Sm2DeactivatedYes_Sm3InEsi_Sm3enabledYes_Sm3ActivatedYes
TestStep.WriteLine: INFO | Syncmanager{3} was not deactivated by host controller

Description.Purpose: Check if the requestes SyncMan has a known text and returns yes/no
Description.PreCondition: SyncManager in ESi file element Sm defined at all
Description.Action: - Check ESI element Sm for type = "MBoxOut/MBoxIn/Outputs/Inputs"
Description.PostCondition: - set return value to false if text is known

Equal.RaiseError: INFO | No Sm Element in ESI defined!
INFO: No Sm:Text defined in ESI for SyncManager{0}

Equal.Return: DEBUG: SmTextUnkown = TRUE
